intro: Thesium brachystegium, commonly known as the short-stemmed thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing structure with dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically has wiry, branched stems and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are usually small, leathery, and arranged in whorls around the stems. Thesium brachystegium is adapted to acidic and well-drained environments, often thriving in mountainous or coastal regions.
